item.title: Iterating at the Pace of AI
item.description: Two approaches to building agentic experiences: platform-first vs scenario-first. How AI coding tools enable faster prototyping and cross-functional collaboration for agent product development.

item.title: Social Listening for Product Insight
item.description: Using AI-powered social listening to extract authentic customer insights from online discourse. Moving from product-to-market to market-to-product development through systematic analysis of community discussions.

item.title: When do I Sunset a Product?
item.description: A framework for deciding when to sunset products and projects. Understanding opportunity costs, sunk cost fallacy, and making difficult decisions about failing ventures.

item.title: Using LLMs as a Cover up for Poor Thinking
item.description: How the ease of LLM-generated content masks poor reasoning and why developing domain expertise remains crucial for meaningful innovation beyond automated productivity gains.

item.title: Questions as the New Bottleneck in Learning
item.description: In an age of infinite information, asking the right questions has become more valuable than finding answers. Exploring how question formulation is transforming education and knowledge acquisition.

item.title: Why People Care What Others Think
item.description: Understanding collective intelligence and social dynamics. Why crowd psychology matters for product builders and how human need for belonging drives engagement patterns.

item.title: Value Add of AI: Generation as Distribution
item.description: Exploring how AI's greatest value shifts from content creation to personalized distribution and synthesis. From RSS feeds to knowledge liquefaction and the future of adaptive content experiences.

item.title: Product Engineers and AI Multipliers
item.description: How AI is transforming product engineering teams into smaller, more efficient units. Learn why product engineers are becoming more valuable than traditional product managers in AI-first organizations.

item.title: Interesting Reads
item.description: Curated collection of compelling articles and insights on AI agents, entrepreneurship, and product development. Features analysis of breakthrough AI tools and emerging trends.

item.title: The Craft of Miyazaki in an AI-Generated World
item.description: Explore Hayao Miyazaki's meticulous animation process and its significance in today's AI-generated creative landscape. Learn about the value of craft in a world of automated content.

item.title: User Needs & Opportunities
item.description: Identifying real user pain points and business opportunities through conversations and online research. A collection of validated user needs that could become viable startups.

item.title: 2024 in Review
item.description: Reflecting on 2024: lessons from founding Cogno, the importance of hands-on product development, choosing college over dropping out, and key insights for first-time founders.

item.title: How to Work on What You Love
item.description: Curated advice from successful entrepreneurs and thinkers on finding passion, going deep on interests, and building a meaningful career doing what you love.

item.title: Essence of Creativity: Future of Creative Work
item.description: Exploring the intersection of AI-generated content and human creativity. Analysis of creative workflows, multimodal interactions, and the future of content creation in the AI era.
